sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Charters, Letters, Bulls, Liturgical Texts, Anglo-Norman Texts etc.
Chartae, Liturgica, Poemata, etc.
msDesc.p: Vellum, 220 150 , 8.7 x 5.8, ff. 1 + 253, several volumes of cent. xiii and xiv early, all well written.

Volume I: In charter hand, 29 lines to a page.
Volume II: Cent. xiii early, in red, black and green.
Volume III: In a good black hand, 24 lines to a page. Cent. xiv early?
Volume IV: The next division, in charter hand
Volume V: In a good set hand: the prose rather smaller than the verse: there are 31 and 30 lines to a page respectively.
Volume VI: In charter hand.
Evidently belonged to the brethren of St John of Jerusalem at Waterford.

head.title: Bull of Pope Alexander IV to the Knights Hospitallers of Ireland, 21 May 1255
Bulla Alexandri papae concedens fratribus hospitalis Hierusalem in Hibernia ut sint immunes ab omni ordinaria jurisdictione

msItem.ab: dated xii Kalendas Junii pontificatus anno primo

head.title: Bull of Pope Alexander IV to the Knights Hospitallers in Ireland, 5 February 1259
Bulla ejusdem papae ut non teneantur dicti fratres solvere procurationes

msItem.explicit: Anngine (!) nono Februarii pontificatus anno quinto

head.title: Bull of Pope Alexander IV concerning excommunication, suspension and interdict, 20 February 1256
Bulla ejusdem papae ut nulla sententia excommunicationis suspensionis aut interdicti promulgetur in dictos fratres aut clericos, ecclesias vel oratoria eorum sine speciali mandato sedis apostolicae

msItem.explicit: Lateran. x kalendas Marcii pontificatus anno secundo

head.title: Letter of Edward I regarding the Knights Hospitallers of Ireland (1281)
Breve regis vicecomiti Waterford directum ut supersedeat demandae quam fecit priori et fratribus hospitalis Sancti Ioannis Hierusalem in Hibernia vel Ioanni Gilbert tenenti eorum
Bull of Pope John XXII concerning the transfer of the property of the Templars to the Knights Hospitallers, 17/3/1317
Bulla Iohannis papae de translatione bonorum templariorum ad ordinem fratrum Sancti Ioannis de Hierusalem

msItem.explicit: Auinion. xvi kalendas apriles anno pontificatus primo

msItem.head: Prophecies of Merlin (Prophecies of the Six Kings attrib. Merlin)

head.title: La prophetie [de] Merlin

msItem.ab: A larger hand, 29 lines to a page
msItem.incipit: Ci comencent akuns des prophetiez des merueilles que merlyn dit en son tens de engletterre, etc.
Vn aignel vendra hors de wyncestre que auera blanche lange
msItem.explicit: et si finirount les heirs dengleterre hors de lur heritage
msItem.ab: Occurs also in Harl. 746. Ward, Cat. of Romances I 309

msItem.head: Bede the Venerable (attrib.), De Temporibus Liber chap. XVI-XXII (Observations on the Six Ages in Anglo-Norman). List of Kings. Charms. The Perilous Days

head.title: Table chronologique faite le 17 anne du regne d'Edouard II

msItem.rubric: Ici comence le numbre de Adam taunt ke al incarnacioun iesu crist sicum de souz est escrit
msItem.incipit: Adam auoit Cc xxx aunz quant il engendra seth
msItem.explicit: le sist age du mund quant il nasqui de la virgine marie en le auesprement du mund a ky seit honurs e pussaunce saunz fyn. Amen
msItem.ab: See Romania XIII 500. The tract is in Bede (P. L. XC 288)
msItem.incipit: Ly Reys Athelwlt' regna xviij aunz
msItem.explicit: Harold sun sorurge .xi. semeynes
msItem.incipit: Jci comence les nouns des Reys puis la venue Willyame le Cunquerour qe fu dit Bastard
msItem.explicit: Puis Edward (II) soun fuiz qe auoit Regne quant ceste date fu fete xviij aunz (i.e. 1325)
msItem.ab: Charm for a wound
msItem.incipit: Sicut longeus ebreus lancia fixit latus domini nostri Ihesu Christi nec diu sanguinauit, etc.
Mem. Luna ianuarii in media nocte actenditur. Luna ffebruarii inter mediam noctem et gallicantum accenditur, etc.
Dites treis pater nostres ou le noun du pere, etc.
msItem.ab: (Charm for crops)
On unlucky days
msItem.incipit: Le meystres ky controuerunt lart numbrerunt le malures e le perylous iours qe sent e le an

head.title: Interpretation of Dreams
De la signification de songes
Of dreams

msItem.incipit: Ky vout sauer la syngnifiaunce de sounges il deit dire ces .iii. salmes

head.title: De vita christiana
De vita christiana ad cujus observantiam quilibet christianus obligatur

msItem.rubric: De uita christiana ad cuius obseruanciam quilibet christianus obligatur
msItem.incipit: Qui dicit se in christo manere debet sicut ille ambulauit et ipse ambulare. Christianus est qui in omnibus misericordiam facit, etc.
O frater si uis scire quis est uere penitens, etc.
Si tu frater velis scire omnem legem
msItem.explicit: memorare nouissima tua et in eternum non peccabis
msItem.incipit: O maria dei genitrix gloriosa
Benedicatur hora qua deus homo natus
Experimentum probatum. Cum mane leuaueris michaelem habe in mente et letum diem habebis
msItem.ab: (The other names of angels are Gabriel, Uriel, Raphael, Raguel, Barachiel, Pantasseron)
Ends
msItem.explicit: Urielem et Thobielem cura ad principem vel ad seniorem veneris et sine periculo ibis
msItem.incipit: Die martis in festi Sancti Marci ewangaliste anno domini mo cclxxxiiijto natus fuit Edwardus filius Regis Edwardi apud Carnaruam ante horam terciam secundum Jacobum donati

msItem.head: Incantation contre les maux et les périls. Epistle of Jesus to Abgar

head.title: Incantation contre les maux et les perils

msItem.incipit: Seynt leon apostoile de Rome escrit ceste lettre e dit ky vnkys le lirra ia cel iour ne estout det' sun enimi, etc. + messias + sother + emanuel, etc.
Assistunt hinc famulo tuo + Willelmo + hoc scriptum portanti, etc.
beatus es qui non uidisti me, etc.
msItem.explicit: in dei nomine securus ambulabit
msItem.rubric: Explicit epistola quam dominum nostrum Ihesum Christum manum (!) scriptam misit ad abagarem Regem qui eum videre desiderabit (!) + Ihesus + Nazarenus + Rex + Iudeorum + Miserere mei +
msItem.ab: In charter hand: Verses

lg.l: Quem fortuna leuis miserum facit esse beatum
Of noman liche makeȝ hap in a stound many Riche
Hym can he so fette weryt fyrst hym fond sone sette.
Est res exempli confusa superbia Templi
Ilk wisman takeȝ forbysne wat pride maket
Of wylum templeis wyh helde non cyre til hem pres.
Heyl god ye schilde modyr holy kyng bere milde, etc.
And left vit sourwe van deȝ comyt after amorwe.

Lagenia continet xxxia cantres

seg.rubric: In festiuitate Sancte brigide uirginis non martiris. Ad uesperas super psalmos antiphona

seg.incipit: Anno ab incarnacione domini nostri Ihesu Christi milesimo cco viiio viio Idus augusti presidenti (-te) sedi apostolice domino innocentio papa quarto, cathedesensis ecclesie obtinente uenerabili episcopo dauid
seg.explicit: benedictum spiritum emisit et sic cum Christo mundo quieuit ab isto
seg.ab: See Caulfield, Life of St Fin Barr, 1864

seg.incipit: Maxentius imperator anno regni sui tricessimo quinto

Uenerabilis presul tyhernachus regali natalium prerogatiua
seg.ab: There are a good many marginal corrections
seg.explicit: cum dulci melodia secum sustulit. ubi perhenni perfruitur gloria in secula seculorum. Amen

msItem.incipit: In primes si vn chitesein fiert vn forein
msItem.explicit: de faire les amendes a chelui ail feri soulom coe qe les trespas amounte. E estre amercie greuousement

Annales brevissimi seu notae chronologicae a nato Christo usque ad annum 1308

head.title: Bull of Pope Boniface XIII confirming Rule of the Knights Hospitallers by Raymond du Puy, 7 April 1301
Bulla Bonifacii papae de confirmatione regulae ordinis fratrum Sancti Ioannis Ierusalem a quodam fratre Raymundo conditae

msItem.incipit: Bonifacius epistola Culminis apostolici solii
msItem.explicit: Datum lateran. vii Idus Aprilis anno pontificatus sexto

head.title: The Rule of the Hospitallers (Order of the Hospital of St John Jerusalem)
Legende de la fondation d'une hospitale sur le mont de Calvaire
Poem in French on the origin of the Hospitallers and their Rule

ab.quote: Hospitalis ut videtur Sancti Ioannis de Hierusalem, nam post narrationem multorum miraculorum sequitur eshortatio fratris Raymundi regulae eiusdem ordinis autoris

lg.l: Al tens zezar (i.e. Cesar?) le premerain
Ke fu prince de sus lui
Eu une esueske en la cite
Par sonn dreit nun (?) quant fu nez
Cist fu pro dome de sa lay
Fors tant cum il fist une desray

msItem.ab: Antiochus wishes to kill Melchiazar, but has a vision forbidding him to do so and telling him to found an establishment on Mount Calvary
On 259 we have mention of Judas Maccabaeus and on 260 of Zacharias who succeeds Melchiazar and is succeeded by St Julian

lg.l: As peiz as meins tut as premiers
Al derein iur de sa iustise
Cist Reimund dunt vous ai dit
De ceus prist conseil qui meuz ualeient
Ki plus de la lei deu cunisseient

msItem.ab: The remainder of the poem appears to be an exhortation based on the Rules of the order: ending 310

lg.l: Tuz nus eime deu par sa grace
Amen amen e deu le fasce
Ke deu nus otriet la grant rente
La quele ia ne poet descretre

msItem.ab: Apparently never printed

head.title: Prayer to the Virgin: Aves, Joys, Litany of Saints
Prière à la virgine Marie
Litany to the Virgin in verse

lg.l: Aue seinte marie mere al creatur
Reine des angles plaine de dusur
Aue esteile de meir de grant resplendisur
Eschele de parais saluz de pecheur
Aue seinte marie la uerge al rai iesse, etc.

msItem.ab: John Evangelist, John Baptist, Peter, Paul, Andrew, James, Thomas, Bartholomew, Simon, Thaddeus, Matthew, Barnabas, Stephen, Laurence, Thomas (Becket), George, Nicholas, are invoked and the poem ends

lg.l: E si requer les uirgines e cele duce flurs
Requerez ma dame ke ele ma sait succurs
Gloriuse raine eez de mai merci
Pur amur Ihesu crist ducement vus pri.
Qui cum patre et filio uiuit et regnat deus per omnia secula seculorum. Amen

msItem.ab: Also in the Phillipps MS. 8336. Described and specimens given by P. Meyer, Romania XIII 509

head.title: Disticha Catonis, translated into Anglo-Norman by Elias of Winchester)
Les distiches morales de Caton mises en vers par Helis de Guyncestre
Caton by Helias of Winchester

lg.l: Ke catun a sun fiz aprent
Si en latin nel set entendre
Ici le pot en rumaunz aprendre
Ki deu mette a sa destre
Cum ieo ma apacuy mut plusurs
Ceo fit la breuent de mun ententement
Ken la raisun ioius deus vers sulement
Kil translata len entent tut autresy
Duz helyes dunt deus ait mercy.

msItem.ab: On the author, see Wright, Biogr. Brit. Litt. II 123. Stengel, Ausg. Abh. Geb. roman. Philol. XLVII 1886

head.title: Le Petit Sermon
Vers sur l'amour du prochain
Poem on Love

lg.l: Par la mesure de sa bounte
Chescun uaut taunt cum il eime
Si cum seint pol uus enseigne
Il dist si il eust chescun ben
Si il ne eust amur ne serreit ren
Ausi cum par mi ta nus
Lalme od deu nad pour nus
Ki ben pensat de mort subite

head.title: Le Petit Sermon (continued)
Vers sur le jour du jugement

lg.l: Ceo est a iour de iuise
Ke cel e tere fist de nent
Od lui en la pardurable uie
La nus meine la douce marie. Amen

head.title: The Fall, Harrowing of Hell, and Passion
De passione Christi

lg.l: Pur le amur de sa amie

msItem.head: Perot Garbelei, Diuisiones mundi

head.title: Divisiones mundi [autore Perot de Garbelie]

msItem.ab: (by Perot de Garbelei)

lg.l: E les gens ki i sunt
Pur ceo sen est par fei
Le gre e le uoler, etc.
Del mund e queus i est

msItem.ab: Not printed

msItem.head: Gillebert de Cambres OCist, Lucidaire (incomplete)

head.title: De Anti-christo

lg.l: Ben me as de tut resun rendu
Mult uolenters mestre si ie osase
Kar il ne uoudrunt preu doner
As pours dens pur eus lauer
Lur male vie ne lur peche
Beneit seit ki cist liure fist
E ensement celi ki le escrist

msItem.ab: Seemingly an extract from the French version of the Elucidarium of Honorius of Autun

msItem.head: Adam de Ross, St Paul's Vision of Hell (incomplete)

head.title: Visio sancti Pauli, imperfecta

lg.l: Vus ki estes a deu nomez
La visiun sein pol le ber
E par la sue grant amur
Del almes ki furent en purgatorie, etc.

msItem.ab: Ending imperfectly

lg.l: Sein michel li ad ceo dit
Ami kar deu aueient en despit
Ne dampne deu plein iur ne amerent

msItem.ab: (Catchword) Plus ke autre
It is the version by Adam de Ros. See Ward, Catalogue of Romances II 409
Printed from a Paris MS. by Ozanam (OEuvres VI 413)

head.title: Libre des moralités (incomplete)
Discours des moralités tiré des philosophes
Tract on Virtues

msItem.ab: In prose. Another good hand, which changes perhaps more than once. There are at first 32 and later 22 lines to a page
msItem.incipit: Talent mestoit pris ke jeo recontasse de philosophes lenseygnement de cel clergie ke est apelez moralitez que en plusurs uolumes est enspandue
msItem.ab: On 488 in the place where a catchword is usually put, is written careforde
The tract ends unfinished in a section beginning
msItem.incipit: Tot al premir deit lysires puruoir a sa genz eo qe mester lur est
msItem.explicit: gard tey de conseiller. e bien te puruoy de home loer. ke
msItem.ab: 494-495 blank
Another copy of this is in the Paris MS. fr. 78563.3 which contains works by Geoffrey of Waterford (Hist. Litt. XXI 228)
It is a version of a tract by William of Conches, printed by Sundby

Verses on the temperaments (Largus amans hilaris, etc.)
This page is in the hand of the Lessons above (article 11) and is a waste page of St Antony's office apparently
